intro: Pedicularis lhasana, commonly known as the Lhasa lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes over 450 species of flowering plants, many of which are found in the mountainous regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red, and it typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. Pedicularis lhasana is a perennial herb with a short stem and is often found in meadows and on slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its adaptation to extreme environmental conditions.
